posts.name: Andrew Hendricksen
posts.cooked:
The 3D printable roboRIO Molex SL locking connector inserts are designed to address common challenges faced by teams using custom PCBs for the roboRIO. These inserts provide a locking solution for female Molex connectors, eliminating the need for hot glue and improving the reliability and ease of use of the device.  

Each insert fits into the roboRIO ports, offering secure connectivity with a friction-fit mechanism. While it is recommended to hot glue the inserts to the roboRIO for stability, they can also be securely fastened to Molex connectors for added safety. The modular design allows users to plug in unused female Molex housings directly into the roboRIO ports, preventing metal chips from bridging pins and creating shorts. Additionally, the inserts cover or significantly reduce the space around pins, protecting them from damage or interference.  

During testing, teams found that hot gluing the 3D printed insert to the roboRIO ensures it does not come loose, and there have been no reported issues with bent pins or electrical shorts. The interchangeable nature of the inserts proved particularly useful, allowing teams to switch encoder positions without complications.  

CAD files for the inserts are available, and successful prints have been achieved using a Prusa MK4 printer with appropriate settings. These inserts represent a practical solution for teams aiming to streamline their roboRIO setup, though they may become obsolete as newer technologies emerge.

posts.cooked: Really cool! How much holding force does the print have on the molex connectors?

posts.name: Andrew Hendricksen
posts.cooked: That is not something I have experimented with yet, but my guess is it would be comparable to normal Molex connectors.

posts.name: Marcus Ford
posts.cooked: i love this idea! houndhat uses a printed sock as a tag, but even though i didn't realize it before, it's such a clever solution.

posts.name: Liam
posts.cooked: I can attest. We have been using this all year and it has been absolutely fantastic and robust. I highly recommend.
